Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Barack Obama's Columbia University ID says he was a foreign student and went by "Barry Soetoro," when there is no evidence to support this.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there are no records or evidence to suggest that Obama ever went by his childhood alias while attending Columbia University.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the fake ID is genuine and uses it to support the belief that Obama was foreign-born.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided that the ID is fake and the photo used is not of Obama as a young college student.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Columbia University did not start using digital ID cards until 1996, which is 13 years after Obama graduated.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
